title: Paper Plate Sun
description: A cheerful sun made from a paper plate and yellow construction paper.
instructions: Paint the paper plate yellow and let it dry.
Cut out triangle rays from the construction paper.
Glue the rays around the edge of the plate.
Draw or glue a face in the center if desired.

title: Toilet Roll Binoculars
description: Fun pretend binoculars made using toilet rolls and yarn.
instructions: Tape the two toilet rolls side-by-side.
Decorate the rolls using stickers or markers.
Punch a hole in the outer edges and tie yarn for a neck strap.

title: Button Art Canvas
description: Create a shape or letter using colorful buttons on a canvas.
instructions: Draw your design outline on the canvas with pencil.
Apply glue inside the outline area.
Stick buttons onto the glued area until the design is filled.
Let it dry completely before displaying.

title: Egg Carton Flowers
description: Recycle egg cartons into painted flowers for decoration.
instructions: Cut flower shapes from the egg carton cups.
Paint the flower shapes and let dry.
Poke a hole in the center and insert pipe cleaner for the stem.
Glue if needed to hold it in place.

title: Popsicle Stick Puzzle
description: Create a small puzzle by drawing a picture on lined-up sticks.
instructions: Line up popsicle sticks side-by-side and tape the back to hold them together.
Flip and draw a picture or pattern on the front.
Remove the tape and mix the sticks up to make a puzzle.

title: Tissue Paper Stained Glass
description: Simulate stained glass using tissue paper and wax paper.
instructions: Cut tissue paper into small shapes.
Glue the tissue pieces onto wax paper in a colorful pattern.
Cut a frame from black paper and glue it on top.
Hang in a window for sunlight to shine through.

title: Handprint Tree
description: Create a tree with painted handprints for leaves.
materials: Marker or brown paint for trunk
instructions: Draw or paint a tree trunk on paper.
Dip hands in different colored paint and press above the trunk as leaves.
Let it dry and display your fall or spring tree.

title: Paper Roll Butterfly
description: Make a butterfly from a toilet paper roll and decorated paper wings.
instructions: Wrap and decorate the toilet paper roll as the butterfly body.
Cut out wing shapes from paper and decorate them.
Glue the wings onto the back of the roll.
Add pipe cleaner antennae and eyes to complete it.

title: Salt Dough Ornaments
description: Create ornaments with salt dough and paint them.
instructions: Mix flour, salt, and water to make dough.
Roll out dough and cut shapes with cookie cutters.
Make a hole at the top for string, then bake until hard.
Paint and decorate once cool.

title: Paper Bag Puppet
description: Make a puppet using a paper lunch bag and decorations.
instructions: Decorate the flap of the bag as the puppetâ€™s face.
Add eyes, ears, mouth, and hair using cut paper and glue.
Color the body section and arms.
Let dry before using as a puppet.

title: Clothespin Airplanes
description: Build mini airplanes with clothespins and craft sticks.
instructions: Glue one craft stick horizontally on each side of the clothespin for wings.
Add a smaller stick on top/back as the tail.
Decorate with colors or stickers.
Let glue dry before playing.

title: Pom-Pom Caterpillar
description: Create a fuzzy caterpillar from pom-poms and googly eyes.
instructions: Glue pom-poms in a line on a strip of cardstock.
Add eyes and pipe cleaner antennae to the front pom.
Let it dry and bend into fun shapes.

title: Coffee Filter Flowers
description: Make beautiful flowers using dyed coffee filters.
instructions: Color filters with markers and spray lightly with water.
Let dry completely.
Fold and twist into flower shapes.
Wrap with pipe cleaner to make stems.

title: Pasta Necklaces
description: Color pasta and string it into wearable necklaces.
instructions: Mix pasta with food coloring and a splash of alcohol in a plastic bag.
Let pasta dry on a tray.
String dried pasta to make necklaces or bracelets.

title: Rock Painting
description: Decorate rocks with fun colors, faces, or messages.
instructions: Wash and dry rocks.
Paint designs, faces, or words on the surface.
Let dry and seal for outdoor use if desired.
